intro: Boehmeria parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including China, India, and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and alternate, ovate leaves with serrated margins. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in spikes and are typically wind-pollinated. Boehmeria parvifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
